name: Homemade Soft Pretzels
headline: Homemade Soft Pretzels
description: For a taste of the fair at home, try Alton Brown's Homemade Soft Pretzels recipe from Good Eats on Food Network.
keywords: European Recipes,Dairy Recipes,Egg Recipes,Side Dish,Recipes for a Crowd
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 cups warm (110 to 115 degrees F) water
1 large egg yolk beaten with 1 tablespoon water

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the water, sugar and kosher salt in the bowl of a stand mixer and sprinkle the yeast on top. Allow to sit for 5 minutes or until the mixture begins to foam. Add the flour and butter and, using the dough hook attachment, mix on low speed until well combined. Change to medium speed and knead until the dough is smooth and pulls away from the side of the bowl, approximately 4 to 5 minutes. Remove the dough from the bowl, clean the bowl and then oil it well with vegetable oil. Return the dough to the bowl, cover with plastic wrap and sit in a warm place for approximately 50 to 55 minutes or until the dough has doubled in size.
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Line 2 half-sheet pans with parchment paper and lightly brush with the vegetable oil. Set aside.
Bring the 10 cups of water and the baking soda to a rolling boil in an 8-quart saucepan or roasting pan.

In the meantime, turn the dough out onto a slightly oiled work surface and divide into 8 equal pieces. Roll out each piece of dough into a 24-inch rope. Make a U-shape with the rope, holding the ends of the rope, cross them over each other and press onto the bottom of the U in order to form the shape of a pretzel. Place onto the parchment-lined half sheet pan.

Place the pretzels into the boiling water, 1 by 1, for 30 seconds. Remove them from the water using a large flat spatula. Return to the half sheet pan, brush the top of each pretzel with the beaten egg yolk and water mixture and sprinkle with the pretzel salt. Bake until dark golden brown in color, approximately 12 to 14 minutes. Transfer to a cooling rack for at least 5 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: I think these might be the best pretzels I've ever had.. Even the next day out of the bread box they were so good.
Marvelous!!! They disappeared in minutes.  Next time I doubled it so I got one!!
Started out really good and ended really good but took 2 hours to rise after keeping my house so warm, but in the end they turned out so light and fluffy my family ate them all!

I started making yeast breads a year ago and was a bit afraid of the pretzel. Tried this recipe today and it was delicious ... my family's favorite yeast item I have made! Served with a cheddar cheese dip. So good!
These pretzels are soooo good and very easy to make!!!!

Ummm omg amazing. I think I made some previously from another person and didn‚Äôt think they were that good. These were amazingly soft and so good. I ate like 4 pretzels in like 3 days. I‚Äôm about to make another round this week. I tried to freeze and found you need to shape pretzel- don‚Äôt use the lye bath yet- take out of freezer and I tried it two ways 1. Frozen into boiling lye bath and bake ( didn‚Äôt feel it was as good and not as chewy)
2. Take out of freezer, thaw out on counter, then use lye bath- these turned into a little bit better in my opinion. Must make sure to use parchment bec once they thaw them get kind of wet/ sticky
I ate them straight out of the oven
-tried with cinnamon sugar as well and did 2 ways 1. Cinammon/sugar before oven and then 2. After they baked
Found it‚Äôs better to wait to use the Cinamon sugar until after they come out of oven. Put some butter on top then coated them.. great with cream cheese! If you are on fence to make- don‚Äôt be!
Now working on a cheese sauce to eat with
I just made these they are terrific , very soft inside and a slight crunch outside, I did not have pretzel salt so I have a ten year supply of margarita salt so I used that, good stuff,

Incredible. There are some nuances between the written instructions and the video. I followed the video. The pretzels were soft and chewy on the inside and the outside had the perfect crunchy texture. I made a queso blanco Velveeta cheese dip (added garlic powder) to keep it simple. This will be my go to pretzel recipe.
Alton Brown: this recipe ROCKS and really makes a great soft pretzel!
Pretty good!
These were easy and turned out beautifully. The dough needs a little more sugar for my taste though. I used dark brown sugar, 1 TBL unpacked. Next time I‚Äôll use 2 TBL.

I have been making this recipe for years now and it‚Äôs a family favorite - perfect and popular every time. However, my daughter and I have been recently diagnosed with celiac disease. Has anyone tried making these with gluten free flour? Any tips?
My pretzels came out wonderful! Followed instructions to the letter, except I added dark corn syrup (didn‚Äôt have malt syrup) to the baking soda water. Beautiful, golden, and delicious!

I LOVED LOVED THE OUTCOME! The pretzels came out brown and beautiful I didn't have pretzel salt so I used sea salt and it still turned out great! I doubled the recipe and made like 18-22 pretzels and my family gobbled them up within 2 days. They were great!

(notes, since I doubled the recipe I did let it rest longer)
This is my family's favorite pretzel recipe.  I do substitute brown sugar for the white.  I make a cinnamon sugar version and wrap some around hotdogs and add poppyseeds.  Perfect for GameDay.
Very good soft pretzel.
I wrapped the pretzel dough around hotdogs and followed all the steps the same except for the twists. Perfect. Best pretzels and pretzel dogs ever!
Sift your flour! It makes a world of difference for consistent, not-lumpy dough. Make sure you have somewhere warm for the dough to raise and err on the warmer side of the water

Excellent recipe! So simple and such great results! I was worried when my dough seemed pretty stiff during hand kneading, but I added a few drops of water a couple of times and managed to get it smooth without a stand mixer or paddle. I also used 1/3 cup baking soda instead of 2/3 cup, personal preference. These were better than Auntie Anne's! Dipped in warm salted butter, yum. Thank you!!!
These pretzels are so darn good! I‚Äôm going to make some more today or tomorrow. Scrumptious! Thanks Alton for another awesome recipe! üòã

Alton, you da man. First time attempting soft pretzels (and I admit to being afraid of yeasted baked goods in general!), but these turned out flawless. In fact, they're irresistible!
Note: didn't have pretzel salt, so subbed kosher salt on some and sea salt on others. Don't think I will bother ever ordering that pretzel salt, this was a fine alternative.
Soft pretzels were a favorite snack of mine during my college days, and I imagined they were difficult to make; so I overpaid for those vender soft pretzels frequently. Never again!
Thank you, sir.

Ive made 20 batches of these pretzels now. Check your oven - range is 425 - 450 works great. Use a knife to make a slice across the pretzel belly! This recipe is great! ( if you want a more pretzel-y flavor bake your baking soda at 300 for an hour to make it closer to lye base).  You can use the egg brush or not. Either way they brown beautifully. Put your salt, or sesame seeds on right after you take them out of the soda bath though if you don't use the egg wash. Thank you Alton- Science rules the flavor on these ( oh yeah - they don't make it to the 10 minute cool down in our house.... butter rules as the hot topping on these right outta the oven!) Heidi
Made for an Octoberfest party and they were a hit!! Used instant yeast instead of active dry yeast.

I made these tonight and added into the dough when rolling it out, some chopped jalape√±o's and sharp cheddar cheese.  Wow!  Very tasty and loved the denser texture of the pretzel.  Although mine were not crispy as I slipped up and daubed melted butter on ours.  Still Very Tasty!  Will reheat with the Egg and Water mixture tomorrow!  Thank you for sharing this one with us!

I was skeptical about making a soft pretzel that would taste as good as the ones made by vendors but this recipe turned out fantastic!! If I could give more than a five star rating, I absolutely would do so.

Bill Paoli (not anonymous!)

This recipe is absolutely perfect! Simple and so incredibly delicious. I do roll out my dough into a longer rope though - around 38inches - as I find it‚Äôs easier that way to make it the proper shape.
This is a no-fail recipe! They came out very soft, golden brown and super tasty! I‚Äôm so proud of myself for making these and getting to enjoy them. Thank you Alton!
Make them every year for our golf tournament. Can I make the dough ahead of time?
Excellent flavor!!  My pretzels came out looking wonky, but there's no question they were home made.

Perfect recipe to make with young children. My grand daughter is three and she commandeeredl ¬†one piece of dogh and loved rolling the it and then wearing it as bracelet. She did help with the twisting and shaping orthe rest and then the egg wash. Gramma was in charge of the boiling ater part of the operation. The result was delicious.

Love this recipe! ¬†I‚Äôve done traditional soft pretzels but I‚Äôve also used it to make pretzel buns for sandwiches and my favorite use‚Ä¶pretzel pearl necklaces for BeerFest. ¬†Make your necklaces even better by adding some individually wrapped string cheese or mini dry salami. ¬†‚ù§Ô∏èüç∫ü•®

Made these for Super Bowl and giving 4 stars because my guests liked them. I thought they looked (very puffy) and tasted like a bagel, and they didn‚Äôt get the traditional brown that you would expect. I baked them longer but was afraid they‚Äôd get hard. Tasty fresh out of the oven. Not as yummy as leftovers. I think I‚Äôll try Altons bagel recipe instead.¬†
Best pretzels ü•® ever! Wondering‚Ä¶.can I use self rising flour instead of yeast??¬†
These came out beautifully, simple recipe!¬†

Love this recipe I have made it many times! I've used kosher salt, bagel seasoning, sesame seeds because there kinda bagke like so I like to change it up, for the wash I use 1 egg and water posed to the yolk why? I find it darkens it too much to our liking. It's a wonderful recipe¬†
This is a family favorite for any game day party!!

Definitely better than Guy Fieri‚Äôs recipe! And you don‚Äôt have to buy any specialty ingredients for it. (Food Network should pull Guy‚Äôs recipe down from their site). Love, love, LOVE Alton Brown!! All of his recipes are outstanding and even someone learning how to cook and bake can have success with his recipes. I made these on a cold day that was BEGGING for soft pretzels and beer cheese dip. They were exceptional!!

Ok, pretty solid recipe here. A few things I did and checked. 1) 22 ounces is actually 2.75 cups of flour. This combined with the rest of the wet ingredients made a fairly wet dough, so I added flour by tablespoon until it came together nicely. 2) I didn‚Äôt bother with the baking soda/water bath. Didn‚Äôt think it worth the effort and they still turned out great! 3) If you watch the video, AB puts down parchment paper then sprays or coats that with grease/vegetable oil. I‚Äôd recommend doing this technique as well. Everything turned out great!
This is the first time I‚Äôve attempted making soft pretzels, and this recipe was perfect. Somewhat easy and they turned out pretty and delicious. I‚Äôll definitely be making more.¬†

These pretzels are perfect. As with most Alton Brown recipes, they should be followed exactly. He's already worked out the science and the variables. The result is predictable, reliable and delicious. They improve each time we make them, mainly because we get better at the technique.

These pretzels are so good. I have made them several times following the recipe exactly as written. On this last batch, I made them smaller by dividing the dough into 16 parts instead of 8. Ate some and froze the rest. To heat them, I just pop them in the toaster right out of the freezer for a few minutes until crispy. Hot and delicious!

The best pretzel recipe. Soft with just a bit of chew. These were gone as soon as I took them out of the oven. I changed up the baking soda bath just a little using 1/2 cup of soda and poaching for 60 seconds. Made a batch substituting garlic butter for unsalted, brushed with garlic butter and sprinkled with salt. Yummy garlic pretzels. I used a spiral mixer.

Delicious! Wanting to make again...To make the dough ahead should I refrigerate before I let the dough rise and let it rise slowly in the refrigerator overnight or let it rise in a warm place for the 55 mins then put in the refrigerator overnight? Thanks
The perfect soft pretzel recipe. No need to test other recipes. Would definitely use this one again and again!

This was a fun experience, and a delicious one. Everyone loved the pretzels! Easy, simple ingredients that I had on hand and not over engineered. I will be making it again but wrapping it around some hotdogs! I know I can trust Alton Brown, Baker / chemist / baker extraordinaire.
Followed directions and they came out great. Right texture, color and taste. Will definitely be making them again.
Pretty Tasty!! And truly not that difficult to make.
Perfect! My friends and I loved making these together, and they couldn‚Äôt have turned out better!
Simply amazing. ¬†Everything this man makes is gold
Yummy !
A family favorite
Two thumbs up
I have made these several times now and they turn out perfect! And everyone thinks I am the pretzel Queen lol. Thanks Alton!
Do these freeze well? I'd love to be able to freeze a bunch in order to take some out whenever the mood strikes (and since I love soft pretzels, that should be often!). Thanks much.¬†
This was my first time making these and they were DELICIOUS. One of the best pretzel recipes I've made
Best pretzels ever. We usually use the Auntie Ann pretzel kit, these were so much better and just as easy to make.

I didn't make the full-sized pretzels, I made mini pretzels and I loved them, the only complaint I had was that they tasted a bit like baking soda. Is there a way to prevent that. I am definitely going to make these again, I just don't want them to taste like baking soda. Any ideas?

Outstanding. fairly quick and super easy. I made these into pretzel buns using all of the same techniques except rolling out the rope. Delicious on burgers. I love the attention to detail and that EB weighs out the flour and dough.¬†
I used this recipe making them for the first time ever, and wow! So delicious and pretty easy!!¬†

OMG my husband made these for me this evening and they were so soft and a little crunchy on the outside. PERFECT tasting pretzel, LOVE this recipe. Will try melted butter and cinnamon next time. THANK YOU for my new favorite pretzel recipe ever!!
Perfect every time I make them!!

This was surprisingly easier and turned out great! I made some pretzel bites as well and baked those for about 10 minutes. My only complaint: my pretzels puffed up and looked more like rolls. Next time I‚Äôll probably roll them out thinner.
Made them with my grandkids.... We loved them. Dipped them in nacho cheese. Great cold weather thing to do with the kids.(. ‚ùõ ·¥ó ‚ùõ.).

Great recipe!¬† These have become a Super Bowl tradition with my kids.¬† I follow the recipe and do half the pretzels with everything seasoning.¬† Easy dough and easy process after you've done it once.

These were fairly easy to make, although time consuming. Tasted delicious that night, BUT next day they smelled and tasted OFF. Not sure what happened but what a bummer! ¬†Not worth trouble unless you are feeding crowd same day.¬†
I can't believe how perfect they turned out on my first try,¬† so delicious,¬† looks like I'm going to be making many more!!
So simple.¬† So delicious.¬† Perfect on my first try!¬†¬†

I have been making these pretzels for six years during school snow days. It‚Äôs super easy and I change up the toppings with toasted sesame seeds or everything seasoning. ¬†I actually use a silpat instead of parchment. Never had a problem with them sticking.¬†
Great every time!!

These were amazing! When I thought I overbaked it from the brown color and hard exterior, turns out the inside was still soft. The baking paper stuck to the pretzels, though. I might need to buy new ones.

Came out horrible.¬† Followed recipe to a T, but they stuck terribly to the parchment paper, despite oiling it as instructed.¬† Taste was fine, but not great.¬† Had to tear them off and eat bottomless pretzels.¬† I would not recommend

The first time I made these it was for my son's birthday party ( college age ) .They were huge hit but ¬†I couldn't make them fast enough. The following year I made 10 dozen and froze them. The night of the party I did the water dip and baked them off . Served with a crock pot full of Alton's Welsh Rarebit . Outstanding !
Turn out amazing every time
Excellent!  A new family favorite.  Egg whites worked, too.
Not a traditional soft pretzel. Pretzels come out very soft and fluffy. Not bad but not great.
After reading other reviews, the only change I made was I cut salt by 1/2. Rave reviews from the family.

I always make these into ‚Äúnuggets‚Äù since I make them to share with larger groups. Pairs amazing with white quest, as I‚Äôm sure anyone could imagine.¬†

Always a hit. Super easy recipe. Thank you, Alton!¬†

I make these all the time and they are delicious. I mix in the stand mixer and let the dough come together and pull away from the sides about 1-2 minutes then I kneed by hand for 4-5 minutes. Until the dough is soft and it bounces back when pushed in. Thanks for another awesome recipe Mr. Brown!

The pretzels were extremely doughy and did not have a crisp exterior like other recipes I've used. My sister enjoyed them but I thought they weren't as good, if you are someone who likes a crisp exterior and a soft interior you most likely won't enjoy them.
My first time making pretzels was with this recipe. It‚Äôs so easy to do. I did a cold bath instead of using boiling water for a different consistency and everything bagel seasoning. Delicious!
These are perfect. The whole family loves them. So soft with just enough resistance on the outside. We eat them with cheese sauce, but they‚Äôre lovely on their own.
I have tried other recipes, and this one turns out perfect every time! Toasty brown on the outside and light and chewy on the inside.

This is a delicious and consistent recipe!¬† We make a double recipe each year and weave the pretzel strands into a cornucopia and bake.¬† We use a king sized aluminum disposable baking tray that is bent and shaped to make a half cone on a baking sheet, weaving the strands & laying them over it. A couple of skewers can help hold everything in place but sometimes aren't needed. After it cools we remove it from the baking sheet leaving the aluminum cone in place for support & fill with fresh fruits and vegetables. It is a stunning centerpiece for Thanksgiving & gets rave reviews.
I‚Äôve made this recipe 3 times, and it turns out perfectly every time. So so good. Better than what you get at restaurants or sporting events!

Great results!! Made these a few times now and, yes, it all works out the way the recipe says and the video shows. I would take a picture but over half are gone the minute they come out of the oven.
The only added note I would give is to cover the raw pretzel dough with maybe a lightly oiled parchment paper so it doesn't dry out on the outside while you are boiling them. Alton does point this out, though, on the show.
Hey Alton !¬† Seems like you forgot to mention that the pretzels will stick to the parchment.....that was fun, still laughing....ha ha !!!!!
It‚Äôs perfect. Shocker! I‚Äôm in a humid climate and needed extra flour to make the dough come together.

i've made this recipe three times. the first i followed exactly ...until i accidentally had to re-roll my dough into long pieces before twisting because i separated into four pieces instead of eight. learned handling the dough, as with almost every baking recipe involving dough, the less you handle it the better. the second time i made it, getting the large pretzels in and out of boiling water was, again, cumbersome. i needed a large flat spatula and a spider strainer to help the floppy dough out of the water. it was hard for me to keep their shape once out of the water but they are extremely malleable and could be re-formed delicately. the third time i went off book and after rolling out the long pieces, i cut them into pretzel bites!¬†

i did not weigh each bite to be exact but i did have a second pair of hands helping me pop them into the water. getting the pretzel into and out of boiling water within 30 seconds, then egg/water washing, and salting them is hard without two people whether or not you're making full sized pretzels, but if you go the bites route--four hands is a must. with the bites, let the boil until they start to puff up. because there are so many keep your eye on the timer and the dough's surface. removing the bites from the water with a spider strainer was **much easier** than the full-shaped pretzel. my husband separated the bites onto the prepared baking sheet after their boil, egg/water washed, and salted them. they took the same 12-14 minutes to cook. they will puff up in size.¬†

this is a fantastic recipe. it makes as many pretzels as you want, depending on the size you roll and form. the longer the roll the easier you'll have twisting them, but i assume you could do any shape.¬†i was tempted to make bites because my husband and i couldn't eat the eight pretzels this recipe yields all in time. even after cooling and immediately putting into an air tight storage container, by the end of a week they simply weren't as good. (although if you slice it to fit into a toaster oven...it's delicious.) i wouldn't recommend putting them back into the oven/broiler to re-heat ..it will affect the outside layer and texture of the pretzel.

my third major takeaway: have a helper for the boiling step; turn the trays halfway through the bake; less oil on your rolling/shaping surface is better than more; thick pretzel salt, more so than large flakes/kosher salt, is best.¬†

Loved this recipe! Easy and delicious. I baked half of them on oiled parchment paper and half on a silicone mat. All the ones on the oiled parchment paper stuck to the paper. Use a silicone mat. They came off beautifully!
Perfect!! Everything Alton makes always turns out amazing. I will always trust to have a great recipe.
Took the second batch to get great pretzel shapes. But all tasted great.  Be sure to bake until really dark golden brown to get true pretzel flavor.
Simple recipe with good results. Taste like the pretzels I ate all through my childhood. Great with yellow mustard or cheese sauce.
Amazingly good!!

video.name: Alton's Homemade Soft Pretzels
video.description: Alton adapts an old bagel recipe and voila: homemade soft pretzels!
